climbs.name: South Ridge
climbs.fa: Merle Wheeler, Gary Stiles, Joe Bernfield, 1970

content.description:
Called the South Ridge in EFR's guide and The Phallus in Steiger's 1985 guide, this route climbs what is really the SW ridge of the pinnacle.

 Steiger says to traverse to the ridge from the right, but what I did was jam up some cam-protected cracks on the SE side of the pinnacle which intersect the ridge about 20 feet off the deck. Then wander up the ridge looking for pro but not seeing much.

 I give it 2 stars because: it has some actual jamming... it was put up a LONG time ago... and it is a naturally protected gear route to the top of a technical-means-only pinnacle.
content.protection: hand-size cams and a selection of stoppers.
content.location: SW ridge of formation, perhaps starting on south side.

content.description:
Old school groove climbing leads to a ledge with a roofy section above. Then a crack leads to pretty jugs and mussys.

 This route is very fun.  Better than it looks... a strong 2 star.  You can reach the summit easily by scrambling up from the anchor.
content.location: The right-hand edge of the sunny SE face of the Phallus has a groove at the bottom.  Start there.

content.description: Pretty good face climb...maybe weak 2 star.  IIRC it's full pad crimping with a slightly slopey finish.
content.location: N side of The Phallus.  Shares start with Casanova, then branches right and up to top.
Starts on left side of N face and goes pretty much straight up.

content.description:
The Phallus is a fairly tall technical-means-only Pinnacle located SW of Goosehead and only about 100 feet from the road.

 First climbed via the SW ridge (5.8 R) in 1970.
